sources.full: Valda's Spire of Secrets: Player Pack

item.name: Frog Prince Statuette
entries: While holding this clay statuette of a frog, you can speak its command word and kiss it to cast the spell {@spell Mandy's Feral Follower|ValdaPlayerPack}, transforming the statuette into a Commoner. The commoner created by the statuette retains the memories of each time it is transformed, no matter what appearance you ascribe to it.
Once it has been used, the statuette can't transform again until the next dawn.

item.name: Leonora's Throne of Indolence
entries: This high-backed armchair made of oak and gold weighs 100 pounds. When you sit in it and speak its command word as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, it hovers beneath you and can fly through the air. The throne has a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 50 feet, can hover, and can carry up to 400 pounds. The throne stops hovering when you speak its command word again.
By speaking a second command word, you can cast {@spell Unseen Servant|XPHB} using the throne. The servant can conjure a spectral trumpet to announce your arrival, in addition to its usual tasks.

Lastly, you can speak a third command word as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to magically create up to 10 pounds of delicious food of your choice and up to four bottles of wine. Only you can partake of this meal and drink; it instantly becomes stale and sickening in another creature's mouth. Once you have spoken this third command word, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Memento Mori
entries: This sealed letter, infused with Chronomancy magic, contains a written description of how the creature that reads it shall die. The letter always contains specific descriptions, such as "The red-eyed orc drove its blade through Faizon the Blue's heart," but may also use cryptic or vague language. It never specifies an exact time. Once a creature has read the letter, it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Death Saving Throws, and dies only after gaining five {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failures, instead of three. However, when the creature arrives at the moment of its death described in the letter, it dies without making Death Saving Throws if it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Once a Memento Mori is opened and read, it becomes an ordinary letter. Its effects end only if the creature that read it dies and is later restored to life.

item.name: Portable Cannonballs
entries: This bag contains twenty iron balls, each measuring one inch in diameter and weighing 1/4 of a pound. When poured out of their bag as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, the balls function as {@item Ball Bearings|XPHB}.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can speak the command word, which causes a number of the balls that you choose to expand into full-size cannonballs weighing 10 pounds each, suitable for firing from a cannon. A creature in the path of one or more cannonballs rolling downhill must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} Bludgeoning damage and have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Large or smaller.

Each iron ball can also be used as a {@item Sling Bullet|XPHB} or a {@item Firearm Bullet|XPHB}. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} when you make an attack with an iron ball as ammunition, you can expand it in midair. On a hit, this attack deals Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d12} plus the ability modifier used for the attack roll instead of the weapon's normal damage.

item.name: Ring of Barrels
entries: This ring has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 1-3 charges to summon a number of empty Barrels in spaces within 5 feet of you equal to the number of charges expended. A Barrel provides {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} to a Medium or smaller target behind it and can be moved or set to rolling with a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. A Barrel has AC 15 and 20 HP.

If you summon a Barrel into a space occupied by a Medium or smaller creature, the creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw to be trapped within the Barrel. It has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its saving throw unless its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0. A Medium creature trapped within a Barrel has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition, whereas a Small or smaller creature has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} from effects outside the Barrel. Bursting free of the Barrel requires a successful DC 20 Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check as an action.

feat.name: Brutal Grip
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heavy Duelist
entries: You can wield a Melee weapon with {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed} in one hand.

entries.name: Versatile Dual Wielder
entries: While wielding a Melee weapon with {@itemProperty V|XPHB|Versatile} in one hand, the weapon has the {@spell Light|XPHB} property for you.

feat.name: Field Commander
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Command
entries: As an action, you can issue a command to an ally within 60 feet that can hear you. It can immediately take an action as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. That action can be used to take only the {@action Attack|XPHB} (one attack only), {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Dodge|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, {@action Influence|XPHB}, {@action Search|XPHB}, {@action Study|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.

entries.name: Tight Formation
entries: While you are within 5 feet of two or more allies that don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, enemies can't have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against you.

feat.name: Focused Critical
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your attack rolls with weapons and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

feat.name: Iron Hero
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Underdog's Resolve
entries: When you are attacked by a creature that has a CR higher than your level, you gain a +2 bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} for that attack.

entries.name: Vengeful Strike
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any creature that has reduced one of your allies to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} since the end of your last turn.

entries.name: Heroic Intervention
entries: When an enemy you can see takes a Legendary Action, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to intercede, preventing the Legendary Action from happening. You can take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

race.name: Geppettin

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Small (about 2-3 feet tall) or Medium (about 6 feet tall; Marionette construction only)
As a Geppettin, you have these special traits.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Construct Nature
entries: You don't need food, drink, or air. You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

entries.name: Handcrafted Quality
entries: Your design might be unnerving, articulated, or friendly. You have proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Gepettin Construction
entries: For simplicity, geppettin are classified by their materials: bisque are porcelain, marionettes are wood, and plushies are made of fabric. Choose one of the following constructions.

entries.name: Bisque
entries: You are indistinguishable from a porcelain doll until the moment you strike. Whenever you deal damage to a creature with a weapon attack roll on your first turn in combat, the creature takes extra damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. The damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

entries.name: Marionette
entries: Loose strings hang from your jointed limbs. During your turn, your reach is 5 feet greater with any Melee weapon that lacks the {@itemProperty R|XPHB|Reach}, {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed}, and {@itemProperty V|XPHB|Versatile} properties.

entries.name: Plushie
entries: You are stuffed with fluff. When you take Bludgeoning damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the triggering damage. You are also knocked 5 feet away from the source of the damage. You can't take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} if you can't be knocked away from the source of the damage.

items.name: Gepettin Construction (Bisque)
entries: You are indistinguishable from a porcelain doll until the moment you strike. Whenever you deal damage to a creature with a weapon attack roll on your first turn in combat, the creature takes extra damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. The damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

items.name: Gepettin Construction (Marionette)
entries: Loose strings hang from your jointed limbs. During your turn, your reach is 5 feet greater with any Melee weapon that lacks the {@itemProperty R|XPHB|Reach}, {@itemProperty 2H|XPHB|Two-Handed}, and {@itemProperty V|XPHB|Versatile} properties.

items.name: Gepettin Construction (Plushie)
entries: You are stuffed with fluff. When you take Bludgeoning damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the triggering damage. You are also knocked 5 feet away from the source of the damage. You can't take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} if you can't be knocked away from the source of the damage.

race.name: Mandrake

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 5-7 feet tall)
As a Mandrake, you have these special traits.

entries.name: Plant Nature
entries: As long as you are in direct sunlight for at least 4 hours a day, you don't need to eat. Additionally, you can breathe through your leaves and you can absorb water and nutrients through your feet.

entries.name: Natural Connection
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Nature|XPHB} or {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Root Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Shillelagh} cantrip and can target yourself with the spell, treating one of your limbs as a {@item Club|XPHB} for the duration of the spell.

When you reach character level 3, you always have {@spell Goodberry} prepared, and when you reach character level 5, you always have {@spell Barkskin} prepared. You can cast each of these spells without a spell slot. Once you cast either spell in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select this species).

entries.name: Entangling Vines
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause grasping weeds and vines to sprout up from the ground around a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the end of the creature's next turn, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. This effect ends early if the creature replaces one of its attacks with with freeing itself. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you reach character level 3, your Entangling Vines gain an additional effect based on the season in which you were harvested (choose when you select this species):

entries.name: Spring
entries: Your Entangling Vines can target an airborne creature within 30 feet of the ground, which is pulled safely to the ground when you use this trait.

entries.name: Summer
entries: Your Entangling Vines can move the target up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space on the ground or floor.

entries.name: Autumn
entries: Your Entangling Vines can affect a second creature within 5 feet of the first target.

entries.name: Winter
entries: The target takes Cold damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

items.name: Entangling Vines (Spring)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause grasping weeds and vines to sprout up from the ground around a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the end of the creature's next turn, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. This effect ends early if the creature replaces one of its attacks with with freeing itself. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you reach character level 3, your Entangling Vines gain an additional effect based on the season in which you were harvested (choose when you select this species):

entries.name: Spring
entries: Your Entangling Vines can target an airborne creature within 30 feet of the ground, which is pulled safely to the ground when you use this trait.

items.name: Entangling Vines (Summer)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause grasping weeds and vines to sprout up from the ground around a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the end of the creature's next turn, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. This effect ends early if the creature replaces one of its attacks with with freeing itself. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you reach character level 3, your Entangling Vines gain an additional effect based on the season in which you were harvested (choose when you select this species):

entries.name: Summer
entries: Your Entangling Vines can move the target up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space on the ground or floor.

items.name: Entangling Vines (Autumn)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause grasping weeds and vines to sprout up from the ground around a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the end of the creature's next turn, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. This effect ends early if the creature replaces one of its attacks with with freeing itself. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you reach character level 3, your Entangling Vines gain an additional effect based on the season in which you were harvested (choose when you select this species):

entries.name: Autumn
entries: Your Entangling Vines can affect a second creature within 5 feet of the first target.

items.name: Entangling Vines (Winter)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause grasping weeds and vines to sprout up from the ground around a Large or smaller creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the end of the creature's next turn, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and can't increase. This effect ends early if the creature replaces one of its attacks with with freeing itself. You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
When you reach character level 3, your Entangling Vines gain an additional effect based on the season in which you were harvested (choose when you select this species):

entries.name: Winter
entries: The target takes Cold damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

raceFluff.name: Geppettin
entries: Ever a joy to children, geppettin resemble living playthings made of wood, cloth, or porcelain. Though easily mistaken for puppets, geppettin aren't manipulated by a just-out-of-sight puppeteer; they are animated, sentient, and independent.

As a species, the geppettin are an oddity. Though rare, they are numerous enough and share enough similarities that they may be counted as an actual species, and not merely freak mishaps of magic. While there might be dedicated creators of geppettin, as there are with golems, many geppettin come to life on their own.

Geppettin are often shorter than halflings. Their physical features vary greatly from type to type, but they often resemble Humanoids. Despite being made of somewhat flimsy materials, sentience grants them an odd hardiness. They never hunger and rarely tire. Most find some form of work or profession in entertainment, but a few find fantastic success as spies and assassins.
As Constructs, geppettin don't age, and mature as soon as they become sentient.

entries.name: Bisques
entries: Bisque geppettin are a form of porcelain doll, crafted with exacting specification and luxurious clothing materials. Though they are designed to look as realistic as possible, they are often the most terrifying geppettin due to their lifeless visages.

entries.name: Marionettes
entries: Marionette geppettin are made mostly out of wood, with painted faces and carved clothing. Due to their construction, their jointed limbs are quite flexible, and they are known to be fantastic dancers. The very largest marionettes, called mannequins, stand as tall as a human and bear completely blank, expressionless faces.

entries.name: Plushies
entries: Plushies, also called raggedies, are any form of stuffed or soft geppettin. Though they often look Humanoid, they may also look like animals, monsters, or any other anthropomorphic creature.

raceFluff.name: Mandrake
entries: With a skin of thick bark and leaves growing at their extremities, you could be forgiven for believing that mandrakes are simply bizarre plants, treants, or animated trees. The truth is far stranger: mandrakes are a bizarre midway between animal and plant. A ruby ichor pumps through their root-veins, and they can equally eat living things or bask in sunlight for nourishment. Depending on the season in which they are harvested, a mandrake might resemble a spry, leafy sapling or thick, woody tree.

Common folks have long held misconceptions about mandrakes—believing them categorically to be wailing babies—but druids know them as the green emissaries who stand between the realms of animals and plants, making peace for all parties. In druidic lore, mandrakes are bespoke creations of a primordial goddess of nature, intended to act as delegates of her will.
Today, mandrakes are rare and make their homes in the forests near where villages and cities meet the true wilds. They live for hundreds of years, growing wider and more gnarled with age.

subclass.name: Path of the Muscle Wizard
subclassFeatures: Path of the Muscle Wizard|Barbarian|XPHB|Muscle Wizard|ValdaPlayerPack|3

subclass.name: Future You Patron
subclassFeatures: I Could Do With Fewer Scars|Warlock|XPHB|Future You|ValdaPlayerPack|6

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Street
entries: {@i Strike with Combos and Special Moves}

"Street fighting" is an urban discipline founded on necessity, whose blindingly fast, unique brand of martial arts has been honed and perfected in back-alley brawls and tournaments alike. Monks who adopt this relatively new technique place comparatively little value on spiritual enlightenment and inner focus; the thrill of split-second timing, rapid combos, and decisive knock-outs drive them to become the best combatants in the world

subclassFeature.name: Combo
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and deal damage, you can expend 1 Focus Point to begin a combo. Until the end of the current turn, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls of your Unarmed Strikes. This bonus increases by 2, up to a maximum of +6, for each successive hit on the current turn. This bonus resets to +2 if you take damage or miss with an attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Fist
entries: Whenever you hit an object with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, the hit is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Special Moves
entries: You have memorized patterns of discrete movements that allow you to use the following special moves.

entries.name: Energy Blast
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can expend 1 Focus Point to replace one of your attacks with a blast of energy. One creature of your choice that you can see within 60 feet makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking Force damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die, or half as much damage on a successful save.

entries.name: Guard Breaker
entries: If you make an attack roll with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and miss the target, you can expend 1 Focus Point to perform a Guard Breaker. This {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} deals damage equal to your Dexterity modifier to the target. This miss doesn't reset your Combo bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: Uppercut
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} and deal damage, you can expend 1 Focus point to make an uppercut. You can push the target up to 5 feet away from you and give the target the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Large or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: Air Dash
entries: On your turn, you can expend 1 Focus Point to gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} until the end of your next turn (no action required). You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next melee attack you make before the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: K.O.
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can attempt to knock the target out. The target takes extra Force damage equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die. If the target has 100 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fewer after you deal damage with the {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 10 minutes.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending 5 Focus Points (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Dungeoneer
entries: {@i Survive the Dungeon}

Only fools would dive headfirst into an abandoned crypt filled with monsters and deathtraps, but it seems only fools emerge from such crypts laden with as much loot as they can carry. The archetypal dungeon delver is a veteran of such suicidal dungeon delves, and has become intimately familiar with the hazards therein. In the course of their adventures, such a Dungeoneer will have adopted countless best practices, along with a litany of unproven superstitions which they believe keeps them alive. Principles from "always be the first one to hit the monster" to "never be the first one to touch a treasure chest" line a Dungeoneer's journal. However, it's probably better to be paranoid and superstitious than lying at the bottom of a pit trap, incinerated by a Fireball, or digested by a mimic.

subclassFeature.name: Kick in the Door
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} attack rolls you make during the first round of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Superstition
entries: You gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} when you do any of the following.

entries.name: Damage Vulnerability
entries: Deal a type of damage to which a creature has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB}.

entries.name: Find Weakness
entries: Trigger a creature's specific weakness, such as {@creature Shadow|XMM|Shadow's} Sunlight Weakness or dealing damage that prevents a creature's Regeneration.

entries.name: Guess the Monster
entries: Guess a creature's specific kind (such as a mimic or lich) before seeing it. The GM confirms if you are correct when the creature is revealed. You can't guess the identity of Humanoids.

entries.name: Secret Doors
entries: Discover a secret door.

entries.name: Trapfinder
entries: Detect or disarm a trap.

entries.name: Treasure Hoard
entries: Find an Uncommon, Rare, Very Rare, or Legendary magic item or treasure worth 100 GP+.

subclassFeature.name: Dungeon Precautions
entries: You can cast any of the following spells without a spell slot: {@spell Alarm|XPHB}, {@spell Comprehend Languages|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|XPHB}, {@spell Find Traps|XPHB}, {@spell Identify|XPHB}, and {@spell Purify Food and Drink|XPHB}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this feature (choose the ability when you cast the spell).
You can use this feature five times and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Kill
entries: Once per turn when you hit an Aberration, Dragon, Fey, Fiend, Monstrosity, Ooze, or Undead with an attack with a weapon, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d10} damage to the target. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Avoidance
entries: When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Veteran Hero
entries: Your dungeoneering expertise gives you the following benefits.

entries.name: Peerless Heroism
entries: Once per turn when you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can expend {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to turn the roll into a 20, instead of rerolling the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Double Inspiration
entries: You can have two instances of {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} at one time. You can use only one {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} per roll.

subclassFeature.name: Arachnoid Stalker
entries: {@i Sling Webs and Crawl Walls}

A life-changing event, such as being cursed by a drider or being bitten by a dangerously transmuted arachnid, has imbued you with the abilities of a spider. This transformation might have left you physically unchanged, or you may have developed a half-dozen eyes, lanky and hairy limbs, or a set of inhuman mandibles. Whatever the side effects, you can now produce deadly poison and ropes of silken web from your palms, and even scale walls with your fingertips.

subclassFeature.name: Webbing
entries: You can magically produce sticky, silken spider webs from your hands as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. This web dissolves after 1 minute. When you create the webs, you can use them to do one of the following.

entries.name: Pull Yourself
entries: You project a line of web at a point you can see within 30 feet, pulling yourself to that point in a straight line without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}. You can use this benefit as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you fall to pull yourself up to 10 feet in any direction.

entries.name: Manipulate Objects
entries: You can use a line of web to manipulate an object that isn't being worn or carried within 30 feet. For example, you can pull an object to your hand, close a door, or snatch a Small or smaller object weighing less than 10 pounds.

entries.name: Create Rope
entries: You create a 60-foot-long Rope of web and anchor it to a point you choose.

entries.name: Web Spell
entries: You cast {@spell Web|XPHB} without a spell slot as a part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} used for this feature (DC equals 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). When you cast it using this feature, the webs fill a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube}, and the spell's duration becomes 1 minute. You can cast this spell using this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Venomous Strike
entries: When you deal {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|XPHB|1} damage to a creature, you can choose for the Sneak Attack to deal {@dice d8}s of Poison damage instead of {@dice d6}s of the same type dealt by the weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Wall Crawling
entries: You've become accustomed to moving like a spider, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Climber
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Hiding on Ceilings
entries: If you are on a ceiling and {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as long as any enemy that could see you is below you.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries: You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

subclassFeature.name: Spider Sense
entries: When you make a saving throw and take damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to use your {@classFeature Uncanny Dodge|Rogue|XPHB|5}, halving the damage you take (round down).

subclassFeature.name: Paralytic Venom
entries: You gain the following Cunning Strike option.

entries.name: Paralyze (Cost: {@dice 4d6})
entries: When you deal Poison damage with your {@subclassFeature Venomous Strike|Rogue|XPHB|Arachnoid Stalker|ValdaPlayerPack|3}, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Muscle Wizard
entries: {@i Be a Buff, Angry "Wizard"}

You're a wizard! Perhaps you went to wizarding school on a football scholarship or just picked up a book at the gym and started reading. No matter how you got here, you're a wizard, one that just coincidentally has massive, rippling muscles. You have the big dumb hat and the book filled with gibberish and everything!

You gently remind others, often by beating them to a pulp and cracking their bones, that your magical powers shouldn't be questioned. You're a good wizard—the best one, even! And only a fool would say otherwise.

subclassFeature.name: Unarguable Wizardry
entries: Your unquestionable legitimacy (and immense pectoral muscles) give you {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB}) checks made to convince others that you are, in fact, a wizard.

Additionally, if someone questions your legitimate magical prowess, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to enter your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} until the end of your next turn. This Rage can't be extended and doesn't expend a use of your Rage.

subclassFeature.name: "Cantrips"
entries: You can call upon your "magic" to cast "Cantrips" in combat. Once on each of your turns when you hit a target with a Strength-based attack, you can use one of the following "Cantrips" of your choice.

entries.name: Mage Hand
entries: You can push the target up to 5 feet straight away from yourself if it is Large size or smaller. While your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, you can push the target up to 10 feet instead.

entries.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: The force of your strike is quite shocking. The target can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} until the end of the current turn. While your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, it can't make Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: True Strike
entries: You really, truly strike, dealing an extra {@damage 1d6} damage to the target. The damage has the same type as the weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} used for the attack. While your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, you add half your Barbarian level (round down) to the extra damage.

subclassFeature.name: "Spells"
entries: Your "magic" is powerful enough to cast every "spell" that exists (and no one can prove otherwise without broken ribs). However, you only prepared the following "spells" today. While your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, you can use each of the following "Spells" once. When you do so, you can't use that "Spell" again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Burning Hands
entries: Your backhand slap is legendary. As an action, you can make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against each creature within your reach. On a hit, this strike deals Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength modifier and the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack it makes before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Magic Missile
entries: As an action, you can make three ranged attacks using {@item Dart|XPHB|Darts}, {@item Dagger|XPHB|Daggers}, or other weapons with {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} that use Strength for the attack and damage rolls. Because Magic Missile never misses, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on these attack rolls.

entries.name: Shield
entries: When you are hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to quickly don a {@item Shield|XPHB} to defend yourself. You gain the Shield's AC bonus against the triggering attack, potentially causing it to miss. If the attack hits, the damage dealt to you is reduced by an amount equal to your Barbarian level.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You're such an amazing wizard that other wizards can't even touch you. While your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

subclassFeature.name: I Cast Fist
entries: You can crush your enemies with your ultimate "spell":

entries.name: Fist
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action while your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, you can replace one of your attacks with a really hard punch. Make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. On a hit, the target takes Bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 6d6} plus your Strength modifier and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Huge or smaller. You can use this feature once per active Rage.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Revelry
entries: {@i Work Hard and Party Harder}

Paladins who swear the Oath of Revelry make a solemn vow to party day and night until their hearts give out. The antithesis of stuffy, lawful crusaders, these emissaries of carousal travel the land, crashing parties and raising hell wherever they raise a glass. Authorities bristle at their arrival, but the youth cheer, for a Party Paladin is always accompanied by a good time.
These paladins share the following tenets:

items: Abide by the doctrines of the Codicus Brodicus.
Celebrate every occasion, inviting friend and foe alike.
When necessary, fight for your right to party.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Revelry Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Revelry Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared. New spells are marked with an asterisk (*).

entries.caption: Oath of Revelry Spells
rows: 3rd
{@spell Charm Person|XPHB}, {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter}
5th
{@spell Enhance Ability|XPHB}, {@spell Hangover|ValdaPlayerPack}
9th
{@spell Create Food And Water|XPHB}, {@spell Hypnotic Pattern|XPHB}
13th
{@spell Charm Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Freedom of Movement|XPHB}
17th
{@spell Geas|XPHB}, {@spell Rary's Telepathic Bond|XPHB|Telepathic Bond}

subclassFeature.name: Conjure Drink
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to conjure a number of mugs filled with frothy ale up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one), which appear in spaces within 30 feet of yourself. A creature that drinks the ale as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Charisma modifier and has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws for 1 minute. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, the mugs and remaining ale vanish.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Fraternity
entries: You and your allies deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on attacks using Melee weapons or Unarmed Strikes while in your Aura of Protection. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Merrymaker
entries: When you or an ally within 30 feet of yourself that can see or hear you makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give that creature {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If the creature still fails the {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, this use of Merrymaker isn't expended.

subclassFeature.name: Party Animal
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can imbue your Aura of Protection with the many-hued magic of revelry, granting the benefits below for 10 minutes or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Extra Damage
entries: The extra damage from your Aura of Fraternity increases to {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Heroic Inspiration
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you can give {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} to one ally within the aura.

entries.name: Immunities
entries: You and your allies have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}, and {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} conditions while in the aura.

subclassFeature.name: Future You Patron
entries: {@i Manipulate Time with Help from the Future}

Your patron is you in a decades-distant future. Perhaps your future self found an artifact of great power connecting them to the past, which they must now lead you to discover, or perhaps they were taught the mystic arts by their future self long ago, a cycle you will have to continue someday. Your future self has forgotten the fine details of some things and outright refuses to tell you about things you "can't know yet," but nevertheless offers compelling insight and guidance. You're not quite sure what your future self is planning for your future (and for their past), but one thing is certain—they need you alive.

subclassFeature.name: Future You Spells
entries: The magic of your patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Future You Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared. New spells are marked with an asterisk (*).

entries.caption: Future You Spells
rows: {@spell Accelerate/Decelerate|ValdaPlayerPack}, {@spell Delay|ValdaPlayerPack}, {@spell Enhance Ability|XPHB}, {@spell Moment to Think|ValdaPlayerPack}, {@spell Recall|ValdaPlayerPack}
{@spell Protection from Energy|XPHB}, {@spell Slow|XPHB}
{@spell Death Ward|XPHB}, {@spell Dire Warning|ValdaPlayerPack}
{@spell Legend Lore|XPHB}, {@spell Rary's Telepathic Bond|XPHB|Telepathic Bond}

entries: In addition, strange effects linger after communicating with your future self. You gain one of the traits from the Future You Quirks table.

entries.caption: Future You Quirks
rows: You often speak in the wrong tense or refer to yourself in a plural.
You sometimes refer to a person by name before they've introduced themselves.
You are unreasonably calm in dire circumstances.
In certain lighting, you look much older than you are.
Seeing certain people alive instantly reduces you to tears.
Your future fashion sense clashes completely with that of today.

subclassFeature.name: It Happened Like This
entries: Your discussions of the future with yourself have given you peripheral knowledge about how events will play out. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, the GM rolls a {@dice d20} and a {@dice d4} in secret and records the number rolled on the {@dice d20}. The GM tells you the recorded {@dice d20} roll, unless they roll a 4 on the {@dice d4}; in that case, they lie about the recorded {@dice d20} roll.

You can replace any {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} made by you or a creature you can see with the recorded {@dice d20} roll (no action required). You must choose to do so before the roll. If the GM lied about the roll, they inform you of the actual recorded {@dice d20} roll only after you replace the test with it.

subclassFeature.name: I Could Do With Fewer Scars
entries: Your future self warns you of particular attacks to watch out for. When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain a +10 bonus to your AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.
You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Expect an Ambush
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage on the first round of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Grandfather Paradox
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can goad a creature within 60 feet of you that can see or hear you into causing a paradox. The creature must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 10d6} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute as it is locked between opposing timelines. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. The {@condition Stunned|XPHB} creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

spell.name: Accelerate/Decelerate

time.condition: which you take when you see an attack roll hit a creature within 60 feet of yourself

components.m: a drop of oil or molasses

entries: This spell accelerates or decelerates an attack (see the chosen effect below) the instant before it strikes, lessening or multiplying its force.

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} damage from the attack. This extra damage is the same type dealt by the triggering attack.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: Reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 2d6} (to a minimum of 0 damage).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The extra damage or reduction in damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1.

spell.name: Clue
entries: When you cast this spell, all footprints and fingerprints within a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you become highlighted and glow faintly for the duration. When you cast the spell, choose any point in time up to 10 days ago. Only footprints and fingerprints left between that time and the present will be highlighted. Each creature that leaves footprints and fingerprints is assigned a unique color, but are not otherwise identified. Any creature that moves or touches objects within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} will also leave colorful footprints and fingerprints, which might reveal {@condition invisible} creatures in the area.

spell.name: Delay
entries: You briefly slow time for a creature of your choice that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be moved to last place in the {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} order from the start of the next round onwards.

spell.name: Dire Warning
entries: You receive a message of up to 6 words from yourself in the future, warning you of a critical threat or pointing you toward a fruitful avenue. The GM determines this message. At some point in the future, once you have learned why you sent the message, you must perform a ritual over the course of 10 minutes, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, to deliver the message back in time to your past self. If you cast this spell and receive no message, it indicates that you will never complete the ritual in the future, possibly owing to your death or another hindrance.
Once you cast this spell, you can't cast it again for 7 days or until you perform its ritual.

spell.name: Defenestration
entries: A wave of force erupts from your open hand, hurling a creature you can see within range through a window. The target makes a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is pushed up to 20 feet and thrown through a window of your choice. If there is no window within 20 feet of the target, it is instead pushed up to 20 feet in a direction of your choice and thrown through a window of arcane force, which materializes behind the creature and vanishes after it shatters. The target takes {@damage 4d6} Slashing damage and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition when it is thrown through a window. On a successful save, the target is instead only pushed 10 feet and takes no damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the distance the target is pushed on a success or failure increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Mandy's Feral Follower
entries: You touch a Medium or smaller Beast, which shape-shifts into a Humanoid with an appearance of your choice. The Beast's statistics are replaced by the stat block of a Commoner but retains its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. You choose the Commoner's skill proficiency. The commoner wears Fine Clothes but has no other equipment, and has a basic understanding of all unskilled tasks.

The target gains 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. The spell ends early on the target if it has no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} left. When the spell ends, the Fine Clothes dissipate into smoke.

entries.name: Combat
entries: The commoner is an ally to you and your allies. It rolls its own {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and acts on its own turn. It behaves as though it is dutifully employed by you.

entries.name: Duration
entries: This spell's duration varies depending upon when and where it was cast. If cast in a location where time passes normally, the spell lasts until the twelfth stroke of the next midnight, however long that may be. Elsewhere, the spell lasts for 24 hours.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can shape-shift one additional Beast for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: Finger Guns
entries: You extend your forefinger and thumb, a dangerous gesture mimicking a gun. For the duration, your hand counts as a Simple Ranged weapon with a range of 60/240 feet and the {@itemMastery Slow|XPHB} mastery property. You can use your spellcasting ability instead of Dexterity for the attack rolls of this weapon. On a hit, the weapon deals {@damage 2d6} Force damage and doesn't add your ability modifier to damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The weapon's normal range increases by 30 feet and its long range increases by 120 feet when you reach levels 5 (90/360 feet), 11 (120/480 feet), and 17 (150/600 feet).

spell.name: Game of Fate
entries: You magically compel a creature within range that can hear and understand you to a nonmagical game with vital consequences. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to join you in the game.

The loser of the game takes {@damage 6d6} Psychic damage. If no player has won or lost by the end of the spell's duration, both you and the target take this damage. If you or one of your allies harms the target, you forfeit the game, and vice versa if the target or one of its allies harms you. Additionally, you and the target creature can negotiate for greater stakes. You can wager for higher Psychic damage (up to a maximum of {@dice 12d6}), currency, property, or more esoteric rewards, such as bestowal of a noble title. The spell reveals if a creature attempts to place a bet it can't fulfill. A bet is finalized when you and the target agree on the bet, solidifying the bet with a handshake or similar gesture. Property or currency bet on the game is teleported to the winner at the game's conclusion. The loser is also magically compelled to take any action (such as bestowing a noble title) wagered as part of a bet.
Lastly, no spell, magical effect, or creature other than you and the target can influence the game's outcome.

spell.name: Hangover
entries: You emit a drunken aura that quickly washes away, leaving an intense hangover. A creature you choose within range makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws it makes to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} as a result of this damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Memorize

m.text: silver string worth 10+ GP, tied in a knot, which the spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, your eyes pass over a page of written text that is committed to your memory. For the next year, you remember the exact details of all information on the page. After that time, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all Intelligence checks you make to recall this information.

spell.name: Moment to Think
entries: When you cast this spell, you briefly stop time for everyone but yourself. You can take one additional action and move around in your space while no time passes for other creatures. That action can be used only to take the {@action Search|XPHB}, {@action Study|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. Furthermore, you can't affect or damage any creature or object, other than objects you are wearing or carrying. If an object leaves your hand, it also becomes frozen in time.

spell.name: Paradox
entries: By twisting the flow of time into knots, you cause one action of your choice taken within range within the last round to be undone. Reality then reasserts itself, recoiling from the damage caused by removing an event from time. The direct effects of that action, such as damage dealt by an attack or spell, are undone, but the indirect effects, such as creatures choosing to move to different locations, are not. The creature that took the action takes {@damage 10d8} Psychic damage, as it copes with its history being modified.

spell.name: Polybrachia
entries: Two muscular arms of brilliant arcane energy appear on a willing creature that you touch. These arms are fully functional and can be used to wield weapons and Shields (allowing the target to simultaneously hold 2 two-handed weapons, or 4 one-handed weapons), perform Somatic components of spells, and perform other actions. For the duration, the target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) checks. The target can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make a melee attack using a weapon wielded by the arms.

spell.name: Recall
entries: Record your location when you cast this spell. Until the end of your next turn, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} in response to an attack roll, a creature casting a spell, or a creature moving within 5 feet of you to teleport back to that location, or to the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. This teleportation precedes the triggering attack or spell. The spell then ends.

spell.name: Rumor
entries: You magically spread a rumor of 10 words or less in a 100-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Any creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that can hear and understand three or more other creatures believes that they hear the rumor being repeated by someone nearby. Different creatures hear the rumor from different people, so a concrete origin is impossible to discern. Generally, creatures won't become {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} upon hearing even the most vicious rumors, but hearing a rumor can affect their attitude positively or negatively.

book.name: Valda's Spire of Secrets: Player Pack
book.author: Mage Hand Press

data.name: Subclasses
entries: At level 3, every class offers a character-defining choice called a subclass that grants you features at certain levels. Subclasses change how the class plays and further differentiate each class into a spectrum of discrete archetypes. For example, all Monks are focused and nimble, but only the Warrior of the Street offers combos and energy blasts lifted from video games.
This section offers six new subclasses for the Barbarian, Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Rogue, and Warlock.

images.title: {@class Barbarian|XPHB|Path of the Muscle Wizard|Muscle Wizard|ValdaPlayerPack|3-0}

data.name: Feats
entries: This chapter offers a collection of feats, which are special features not tied to a character class. A feat represents a talent or an area of expertise that gives a character special capabilities. It embodies training, experience, and abilities beyond what a class provides.
By whatever means you acquire a feat, you can take it only once unless its description says otherwise.

entries.name: General Feats
entries: These feats are in the General category.

data.name: Spells
entries: Without a repertoire of spells, a wizard is merely an academic with an overlarge hat. This section presents a brief compendium of new spells ranging from indispensable utility spells, to whimsical transmutations, to time-bending chronomancy.

entries.name: Chronomancy Tag
entries: To organize these spells and allow GMs and players to filter spells by their preferences, some spells include a tag behind the spell's level and school.

Chronomancy spells, marked with the [Chronomancy] tag, pull at the very fabric of time and manipulate causal events. This rare and elusive magic is largely practiced by spellcasters known as chronomancers, who walk between the ages and glimpse the beginning and end of time. Sometimes the use of Chronomancy is policed by organizations which lie outside space and time, preventing others from practicing this magic. The spells {@spell Haste|XPHB}, {@spell Slow|XPHB}, and {@spell Time Stop|XPHB} also deserve the [Chronomancy] tag, but have been familiar to spellcasters far longer than spells like {@spell Delay|ValdaPlayerPack} and {@spell Paradox|ValdaPlayerPack}.

entries.name: Spell Descriptions
entries: The spells are presented in alphabetical order.

data.name: Magic Items
entries: The magic items are presented in alphabetical order.

data.name: Credits

items.name: Designers:
entries: Michael Holik, Beniamin Ghita, Jaron Mortimer

items.name: Cover Illustrator:
entries: Martin Kirby-Jackson

items.name: Graphic Design:
entries: Michael Holik

items.name: Interior Illustrations:
entries: Martin Kirby-Jackson, Moniek Schilder, Lucas Ferreira CM

entries.name: ON THE COVER
entries: Martin Kirby-Jackson illustrates a view from the foot of the multidimensional Spire of Secrets. High above, arcane vortices churn into other corners of the multiverse, while levitating stones and crystalline mountainsides dominate the valley. Valda, the devious lich himself, stands cackling, staff and infernal spell in hand, to greet his newest guests.
Mage Hand Press, and their associated logos are trademarks of Mage Hand Press LLC
® 2024 Mage Hand Press LLC. All Rights Reserved.
Copyright Mage Hand Press, 2025
{@i Disclaimer: Valda has no relation to that OTHER lich with godlike power. Nobody's ever cut off Valda's hand, and if they did, it wouldn't somehow become a magic item.}
